document.docAuthor: Obando, Ranulfo González, García Aldrete, Alfonso N. & Gironza, Nancy Carrejo
document.docTitle: Euplocania vallecaucana Obando, Aldrete & Gironza, 2015, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of Euplocania Enderlein (Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Psocomorpha: Ptiloneuridae) from Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Euplocania Enderlein (Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Psocomorpha: Ptiloneuridae) from Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: Belonging in species group “C”, in the classification of
García Aldrete et al., ( 2013 )
. Differing from
E. bonaverensis
n. sp.
, described above, in having the median posterior processes of the hypandrium blunt ended, not dilated preapically, and in the general structure of the phallosome (compare
Figs 67 and 68
, with
Figs 7 and 8
in this paper). Female IX sternum (
Fig. 74
), posteriorly pointed, anteriorly convex, with a mesal, U-shaped brown area.

Female. Color (in 80 % ethanol). As in the male. Subgenital plate with sides dark brown. Gonapophyses:
V 1
creamy,
V 2
+ 3 dark brown; IX sternum cream, with a dark brown mesal area.

Material studied. Holotype male. Colombia . Valle del Cauca. Santiago de Cali, Los Andes, finca Monserrate ,
3 ° 25 ' 57.3 ''N
:
76 ° 37 ' 15.4 ''W
, 1682 m ,
2 .IX. 2011
, R. González. Paratypes :
1 female
. Dagua, Queremal, El Edén,
3 ° 31 '20.0''N
:
76 ° 43 ' 38.7 ''W
, 1383 m .
11 .XI. 2012
. R. González. All specimens on dead branches with mosses.
1 male
, Dagua. San Bernardo, Finca Madrigal,
03° 31 ' 34.2 ''N
:
76 ° 40 '10.0''W
, 1745 m . N. Calderón & O. Saenz, on tree trunk.
1 female
, El Dovio, La Hondura,
04° 32 ´ 32.8 ´´N
:
76 ° 17 ´ 11.6 ´´W
, 1452 m .,
7 .IX. 2013
), R. González, on tree trunk (MUSENUV).
Etymology. The specific epithet refers to the Colombian Department of Valle del Cauca, from where this species is endemic.
